headline: 5 people charged with defrauding Pennsylvania's Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program
author: Brian Roche
sentences:
The individuals arrested are:
Regine Ford, 26, of Newark, DE
John Rivers III, 35, of Loganville, GA
Jose Thomas, 43, of Sicklerville, NJ
Shammiere Lackey, 28, of Pennsville, NJ
Adrian Hambrick, 38, of Salem, NJ
Shapiro said the suspects are part of a group of nine people who worked together to file phony claims for unemployment benefits.

To date, the attorney general's office has charged 44 individuals, including 24 inmates and their accomplices, for submitting fraudulent PUA applications amounting to more than $4 million in fraudulent PUA funds.
According to Shapiro, investigators learned some of the defendants claimed to have worked for the same trucking company and claimed their employment ended because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Access to Pennsylvania unemployment compensation system will be limited this weekend
The false applications resulted in $925,273 in allegedly false unemployment claims.
Five people are charged with defrauding Pennsylvania's Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program, Attorney General Josh Shapiro announced Tuesday.
Prosecutors allege the individuals don't work for the company and have no record of being employed in Pennsylvania.
3 more people charged in scheme to steal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance benefits in Pennsylvania
Shapiro said $455,513 was paid out to the defendants.
